data.title: Spring Branch Independent School District
data.meta_description: Home - Spring Branch Independent School District
data.text:
2024-2025

The clock is ticking to recognize our amazing Spring Branch ISD educators for the 2025 H-E-B Excellence in Education Awards!

Whether it's a teacher, counselor, or principal who has made a significant impact, now is the perfect time to show your support and admiration.

Nomination Deadline: October 7

Celebrate the dedication of our outstanding educators by nominating them for their hard work. All state-certified public school professionals in Texas are eligible, and winners receive cash prizes for themselves and their schools!

To nominate your favorite Spring Branch ISD educators, visit the H-E-B Excellence in Education Awards website and submit your nomination before the deadline. Let’s shine a spotlight on those who are shaping our children's future!

For more details and to make your nomination, visit H-E-B Excellence in Education Awards.

Don’t miss this chance to show your appreciation and support for the incredible educators in our community.

Nominate your teacher today!

READ MORE about Nominate Your Favorite Spring Branch ISD Educators!

2024-2025

Spring Branch Independent School District (SBISD) is excited to announce its slate of Parent U events for the 2024-2025 school year.

Designed to empower families during pivotal transition grades, these Zoom-based workshops will offer invaluable insights into supporting your child’s education and navigating the educational system.

Parent U 2024-2025 Schedule

Thursday, September 12 Parent U High School Essentials: A Family Roadmap for Student Success Time: 6:00 PM, Target Audience: 7th-9th GradeThis session will guide families through the essential aspects of supporting students as they transition into high school, focusing on strategies for academic success and personal development.

Tuesday, September 24 Parent U Paying for College: FAFSA/TASFA Orientation Time: 6:00 PM, Target Audience: 12th GradeLearn about financial aid opportunities and the application processes for FAFSA and TASFA. This workshop aims to explain the funding process and help families plan for college expenses.

Tuesday, October 29 Parent U Four Year Planning and Advanced Academics Time: 6:00 PM, Target Audience: 8th GradeExplore strategies for planning high school coursework and advanced academic opportunities, setting your child up for long-term success in their educational journey.

Tuesday, November 12 Parent U Building Bridges to Middle School Time: 6:00 PM, Target Audience: 5th GradeThis workshop focuses on easing the transition from elementary to middle school, offering tips on academic and social adjustments for both parents and students.

Thursday, January 16 Parent U Understanding Math Pathways Time: 6:00 PM, Target Audience: 5th GradeGain insights into the math curriculum and pathways available as your child moves into middle school, ensuring a solid foundation for future success in mathematics

Wednesday, February 5 Parent U Earning College Credit in High School (Dual Credit/Dual Enrollment) Time: 6:00 PM, Target Audience: 9th and 10th GradeDiscover how dual credit and dual enrollment programs work, and how they can provide your child with valuable college credits while still in high school.

Thursday, February 20 Parent U Safeguarding Our Youth: A Parent's Guide to Vaping and Fentanyl Awareness Time: 6:00 PM, Target Audience: All GradesThis important session will provide information on recognizing and addressing issues related to vaping and fentanyl, equipping parents with the knowledge to protect their children.

Tuesday, April 29 Parent U 504/Special Education Accommodations in College Time: 6:00 PM, Target Audience: 11th and 12th GradeLearn about the transition from high school to college for students with 504 plans or special education needs, and how to navigate the accommodations available at the postsecondary level.

Sessions are designed to provide practical advice and support, ensuring that families are well-equipped to assist their children and ensure their academic success!

To register for these events and for more information, please visit the SBISD website or contact the Family E3 team at familye3@springbranchisd.com. Families can register* for these events on the Parent U website as soon as registration opens.

*The district will also notify families when registration becomes available.

READ MORE about 2024-2025 Parent U Events: Equipping Families for Key School Transitions and Success

Spring Branch Independent School District (SBISD) has earned the Texas Art Education Association’s (TAEA) District of Distinction recognition for the fourth year in a row. This accolade highlights the district's ongoing commitment to outstanding visual arts education and fostering student creativity.

Lindsay Ripley, SBISD’s Visual Arts Coordinator, expressed pride in the district’s achievement. “This award is no easy task. It’s a difficult achievement, and our students and teachers knocked it out of the park,” Ripley said. “Winning for the fourth year is truly an honor.”

Ripley noted the importance of art education in developing well-rounded students. “Art education is essential for a comprehensive education. We ensure our students have access to innovative curricula and rigorous projects, which foster creative thinking and problem-solving skills,” she said.

The TAEA’s District of Distinction award is presented to schools and districts that excel in visual arts education and promote art as a vital part of the curriculum. The association’s mission includes advancing professional development, advocating for quality art education, and recognizing exceptional contributions in the field.

SBISD’s rigorous art programming aligns with the Core Characteristics of a T-2-4 Ready Graduate, preparing students for academic and professional success. Ripley highlighted that the award reflects the district's dedication to a well-rounded education, one reason families choose SBISD schools for their children.

“We offer students opportunities to compete at local, state, and national levels, helping them become lifelong artists and creatives. Our dedicated educators inspire them to excel and win. Both our students and teachers truly deserve this recognition,” Ripley said.

Felipe Contreras, an art teacher at Spring Woods High School and part of the award-winning team, praised the collective effort. “This award reflects not just one teacher or program, but the whole team as a collective powerhouse,” Contreras said. “We’re among the top 5 percent of art education programs in Texas. The program in Spring Branch is amazing, and I’m proud to be part of it.”

This ongoing recognition underscores SBISD’s exceptional commitment to advancing visual arts education and its role in developing future artists and creative thinkers. Learn more about the arts in SBISD here.

READ MORE about SBISD Wins Art Education Award for Fourth Consecutive Year
